resources.string: Quill Peer is an application built to aid the networking of delegates within academic conferences, using a combination of data analysis and wireless technology. Quill Peer comes equipped with machine learning techniques that calculate which delegates share similar interests. These matching delegates are also visible on an indoor map that gives a visual representation of surrounding matching people, powered by a network of beacons.

Quill Peer is inspired by the suggestions of Doctors Maria Liakata and Weisi Guo, who told of the issues they had trying to meet people in their areas of research, such as talking to academics from the wrong field of research or talking to a professor\'s students instead of the professor themselves. Hence, Quill Peer is a project formed and developed by a team of six Masters level students aiming to solve this issue.

Hao Dong - Server Side Developer

Loucas Stylianou - Client Side Lead Developer

Sirandjivy Gocouladasse alias Soulormane - Client Side Developer

Andrew Brooks - Project Manager

Kevin Lee - Server Side Developer

Man-Yin Yiu - Server Side Developer
